resources.string: Android 11 introduces data access auditing which can monitor access to all private data
Here, the log of all private data operations is displayed
As an example of private data access, try requesting user location
Start a conversation to see cool new bubble notifications!
Start a conversation and you will see a chat notification
Background location permission request should redirect you to app settings
Background location permission is requested via a regular request dialog
If your app targets Android 11 or higher and accesses the camera or microphone in a foreground service, you must include the camera and microphone foreground service types.

If your app starts a foreground service while running in the background, the foreground service cannot access the microphone or camera. Additionally, the service cannot access location unless your app has background location access.
Try requesting background and foreground location separately
Try requesting background and foreground location simultaneously
Android 11 restricts simultaneous requests to foreground and background location
You can freely request foreground and background location simultaneously. \"Allow all the time\" option enables both, while \"Only while using the app\" option enables only foreground access
Android 11 introduced media controls. Try playing an audio file and check your quick menu to see new, unified media playing experience.
Try playing an audio file. Media controls do not exist prior to Android 11, so you probably won\'t be able to control the meia playback at all.

If an app targets Android 11+, you can query preinstalled system apps but that\'s about it. You can add apps to the filter, but that has to be explicit. If you press the button, you will see system apps and several other apps defined in AndroidManifest \"queries\" section
Query all packages on the device
Android 11 makes permission handling more intentional, so you will not be redirected to app-specific permissions screen. You will be redirected to app settings instead
You should be redirected to app-specific permissions screen
Android 11 introduced one-time permission. Try requesting it and you\'ll see the \"Only this time\" option
Try requesting a permission and you should only see \"Allow\" and \"Deny\" options
Try requesting the permission and denying it multiple times
Starting with Android 11 you should stop seeing the request dialog eventually since \"Don\'t ask again\" is implied on deny
You should see the request dialog every time
Android 11 introduced batch operations on media files. Try adding media to favorites as an example
Android/data and Android/obb directories should be unavailable
Try opening Android/data or Android/obb directory
